item.title: Another java queston, like last time
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“parke5, post:19, topic:96684”]First off, I want my cmd prompt to close when somone presses any key, but i dont want it to say press any key to continue… is it possible to change?

heres my lines of code [code]import java.util.Scanner;

public class UserInput
{
public static void main (String[] args)
{
int intInput;
String stringInput;

	Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

	System.out.print("What is your name? ");
	stringInput = input.nextLine();

	System.out.print("What is your Gender? ");
	String stringInput2 = input.nextLine();

	System.out.print("What is your age? ");
	intInput = input.nextInt();

	input.close();

	System.out.print("Hello " + stringInput +"\nYour gender is " + stringInput2 +".\nYou are " + intInput + " years old!\n ");
	System.out.println("Now you know a little bit about yourself, the quiz is finished.");
	System.out.println("coded by Parke5, run3h4x and mopar member, Please hit a key to end this test........");
	String line = "";
	Scanner s = new Scanner(System.in);
	while ((line = s.nextLine()) != null) {
	    break; // or however you quit;

}
}
}[/code]

can anyone help? also is this what I put in to make it a .jar file, jar cvf Quiz.jar *.class *.java(in the bat)[/quote]

I TOLD YOU TO REMOVE THE ‘input.close()’!!!

I also told you to replace the bottom part that you copied from KryptoN_ with what I showed. You made a total of 0 changes to your code. Look, just here:

[code] import java.util.Scanner;

public class UserInput
{
public static void main (String[] args)
{
int intInput;
String stringInput;

	Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

	System.out.print("What is your name? ");
	stringInput = input.nextLine();

	System.out.print("What is your Gender? ");
	String stringInput2 = input.nextLine();

	System.out.print("What is your age? ");
	intInput = input.nextInt();

	System.out.print("Hello " + stringInput +"\nYour gender is " + stringInput2 +".\nYou are " + intInput + " years old!\n ");
	System.out.println("Now you know a little bit about yourself, the quiz is finished.");
	System.out.println("coded by Parke5, run3h4x and mopar member, Please hit a key to end this test........");

	while (input.next() != null) break;

}
}[/code]

(you have to press enter to end it, also, REMOVE THE ‘pause’ AT THE END OF YOUR BATCH FILE)

item.title: Another java queston, like last time
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:26, topic:96684”]Taharok, you pleb. l2examine errors.

I added System.exit(0); and still nothing. ALso, wtf, it says it cant find my main class file

He says it can’t find his main class. So, I’m pretty sure it’s not starting at all.

Did you compile the class? What’s in your comiple and run.bats?[/quote]

I was pretty sure that it couldn’t find his main class when he tried running his jar because he didn’t set it up right.

parke5:

now it does nothing when I click on the .jar file. I double click and it does nothing

I bet it is working. The problem is that your Scanner is using cmd. So, use the following to run your Jar:

@echo off
title UserInput
java -jar UserInput.jar
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Another java queston, like last time
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Perhaps using System.exit(-1);

Also, please remember that your main class should not have the .class suffix and should be before the classes that you add. From there, make sure your main class was added to the Jar archive.

Read full topic

item.source: Another java queston, like last time

item.title: Another java queston, like last time
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

There is a less efficient way of doing this, and this to add the following at the end of your main void:

System.exit(0);

And making sure the following batch command is inside your run.bat:

pause

[hr]

Here is the batch code to make a basic Jar file:

jar -cfve jarName.jar mainClass classesToAdd.class

So, I would make a Jar file called “hai.jar”. It will hold test.class, and hai.class. The main class is hai.class. I would use the following code:

jar -cvfe hai.jar hai test.class hai.class

Or, if all the class files should be added:

jar -cvfe hai.jar hai *.class

To learn more, type in the ‘jar’ command in command prompt to open up the jar command menu.

Read full topic

heres my lines of code [code]import java.util.Scanner;

{
public static void main (String[] args)
{
int intInput;

	Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

	stringInput = input.nextLine();

	System.out.print("What is your Gender? ");
	String stringInput2 = input.nextLine();

	intInput = input.nextInt();

	input.close();

	System.out.print("Hello " + stringInput +"\nYour gender is " + stringInput2 +".\nYou are " + intInput + " years old!\n ");
	System.out.println("Now you know a little bit about yourself, the quiz is finished.");

	String line = "";
	Scanner s = new Scanner(System.in);
	while ((line = s.nextLine()) != null) {
	    break; // or however you quit;

}
}
}[/code]

can anyone help? also is this what I put in to make it a .jar file, jar cvf Quiz.jar *.class *.java(in the bat)

item.title: Another java queston, like last time
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

Yea, I think you could remove “pause”, and instead of exiting when the quiz is finished, do something like:

System.out.println("Now you know a little bit about yourself, the quiz is finished.");
System.out.println("coded by Parke5, run3h4x and mopar member, Please hit a key to end this test........");
String line = "";
Scanner s = new Scanner(System.in);
while ((line = s.nextLine()) != null) {
    break; // or however you quit;
}

Although I haven’t tested that, or even thought it through.
